channel.title: What is a client & Background Help! Cache and Deob!
channel.description:
Ok i want to edit my background and i have looked around for a while, and all i can find is stuff on editing the cache or needing a deob 450 or whatever please tell me what they mean. I looked in my moparscape folder and i couldnt find anything on a cache!! And What is deob!! Please Post and help me!!!
Can anyone Help because noone is replying?

item.title: What is a client & Background Help! Cache and Deob!
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

That program, use blakescape.

Read full topic

item.title: What is a client & Background Help! Cache and Deob!
item.dc:creator: @mjstar mjstar
item.description:
@mjstar wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:8, topic:115697”]You must be using a 377 or higher. However, I am going to take you back to a quote from the thread.

I found:
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage(abyte0);

Which, the abyte0 can be changed to the path of the image file. You could also, however, use a less dirty method. You could actually change abyte0 where it is called.

I searched around to where the class constructor takes a byte[] for it’s parameter and found:

byte abyte0[] = aClass44_1053.method571("title.dat", null); Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(abyte0, this);
This is at the top of method56() in the client class. You would just switch the abyt0[] declaration to either: String path = "path"; Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(path, this);
Or you could load a byte[] of an image from the internet.

I could be wrong, by the way. This class could be used for other things.

See if following that helps.[/quote]

i dont understand:S what does it mean weird anyway can you please give me a link to where you downloaded yours!! or please email it to me!!

Read full topic
item.source: What is a client & Background Help! Cache and Deob!

item.title: What is a client & Background Help! Cache and Deob!
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

You must be using a 377 or higher. However, I am going to take you back to a quote from the thread.

[quote=“Pwnd, post:61, topic:109427”]I found:
Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().createImage(abyte0);

Which, the abyte0 can be changed to the path of the image file. You could also, however, use a less dirty method. You could actually change abyte0 where it is called.

I searched around to where the class constructor takes a byte[] for it’s parameter and found:

byte abyte0[] = aClass44_1053.method571("title.dat", null); Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(abyte0, this);
This is at the top of method56() in the client class. You would just switch the abyt0[] declaration to either: String path = "path"; Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 class30_sub2_sub1_sub1 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(path, this);
Or you could load a byte[] of an image from the internet.

I could be wrong, by the way. This class could be used for other things.[/quote]

See if following that helps.

Read full topic

item.title: What is a client & Background Help! Cache and Deob!
item.dc:creator: @mjstar mjstar
item.description:
@mjstar wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:2, topic:115697”][quote author=Oh Noes! PIERATS! link=topic=156901.msg1474309#msg1474309 date=1181677523]
What is a deob?
The runescape client is contained in a .jar which any 1 with a little knowledge about java could download, decompile and modify. So they tried to protect it using zkm which obfusticates code to make it undecompilable. Seavion wrote a deobfusticator which can be used to remove the obfustication so we can modify clients. Popcorn recently updated the deobfusticator to deal with the new engine i believe.

Obtaining a deob:

Untainted:Clicky or Pwnds site Clicky Both links are the same file except 1 is in a rar.

Download and save.
[/quote]

A client background is the background of your client. (Short and sweet :P) If you need details on making your own client background, please look in the Client Hacking Section. You should look at the tutorial by me; “Setting Images for Background of Client.” If you need anymore help please post it here and I will assit you to the best of my ability.[/quote]

But i have looked at those and it is always talking about editing cache and stuff but i dont have it? Do i have the wrong thing and if there is do you have a link to the right one?[br][size=1]Posted on: June 23, 2007, 07:31:42 PM[/size][hr]Oops sorry didnt see the thing about deob i thought you just quoted me ok thanks!!!

Read full topic
item.source: What is a client & Background Help! Cache and Deob!

item.title: What is a client & Background Help! Cache and Deob!
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“Oh Noes! PIERATS!, post:25, topic:109427”]What is a deob?
The runescape client is contained in a .jar which any 1 with a little knowledge about java could download, decompile and modify. So they tried to protect it using zkm which obfusticates code to make it undecompilable. Seavion wrote a deobfusticator which can be used to remove the obfustication so we can modify clients. Popcorn recently updated the deobfusticator to deal with the new engine i believe.

Obtaining a deob:

Untainted:Clicky or Pwnds site Clicky Both links are the same file except 1 is in a rar.

Download and save.[/quote]

A client background is the background of your client. (Short and sweet :P) If you need details on making your own client background, please look in the Client Hacking Section. You should look at the tutorial by me; “Setting Images for Background of Client.” If you need anymore help please post it here and I will assit you to the best of my ability.

Read full topic
item.source: What is a client & Background Help! Cache and Deob!
